column1: Now is the perfect time to support local small businesses in our communities.  Remember to shop small for Small Business Saturday and all season long! #shopsmall https://t.co/tvCNbGPTzu
Happy Thanksgiving! https://t.co/vH78CS89rD
The likelihood of virus transmission is nearly impossible when schools have strict enforcement of masks.  It's time to update the COVID quarantine protocols for K-12 schools. https://t.co/Qw6uOs65Gx
Read more in my most recent op-ed: https://t.co/OmrDGFfNpK

I urge our health care providers and leaders to allow local school boards to set their own policies rather than using a one-size-fits-all model that is holding back too many kids families and making it more difficult for us to effectively overcome the effects of the pandemic.
As a result of quarantine protocols we are seeing entire schools being effectively shut down due to the contact tracing guidelines while only a few students may actually be sick with COVID-19.
Three. Years. Behind.   Due to the current state of our K-12 education system that is how far our children could find themselves academically due to COVID-19 restrictions.

Today on National Rural Health Day we celebrate the #powerofrural by recognizing our healthcare workers in #WI07.   Thank you for your tireless work and dedication to your communities! https://t.co/PCJyNXTkEF
I will continue to work to support our veterans and ensure those who have served receive the care and benefits they deserve.

Happy Veterans Day! 🇺🇸   Today we honor the great men and women who have served our nation. Thank you and your families for the incredible sacrifices you have made for us. We forever remain a grateful nation. https://t.co/7049s6mIFq
The election is not over and it is bigger than President Trump or Joe Biden – it is crucial to have transparency so the American people have confidence in the integrity of our election system.

Let’s halt the premature rush to declare a winner in the presidential race to ensure that every legal vote is counted and that every legitimate legal challenge is heard and addressed by our independent judiciary.
Americans want a transparent process that counts every legally cast ballot. https://t.co/rkKuw8P1n7
But there is more work to do.   We need to permanently restore wolf management authority in law to where it belongs: the capable hands of state policymakers and fish and game agencies

Today is a big win for Wisconsin. The announcement to delist the gray wolf represents an important first step toward restoring local control over the skyrocketing gray wolf population in Wisconsin.   https://t.co/ow46vfh41G
Hey @Jack - when the former prime minister of #malaysia calls for ethnic cleansing does that violate your terms and conditions? Asking for a friend. https://t.co/swrCmIqBI6
Congratulations to Justice Amy Coney Barrett! https://t.co/RC6CoHQVKe

The American people deserve less political theater and more work from their elected leaders.  I look forward to watching Judge Barrett become Justice Barrett in the coming days when she is confirmed. #ConfirmACB

Today’s election-year posturing was eerily reminiscent of what we saw in Madison a decade ago when Democrats in our state legislature pulled a “no show” and ran off to Illinois in a desperate last-ditch effort to grind the people’s business to a halt.   They too failed.

The decision by @JudiciaryDems to boycott today's vote on Judge Amy Coney Barrett’s nomination was disappointing unfortunate and an insult to Judge Barrett who has shown remarkable grace and patience throughout these proceedings.
More information here: https://t.co/oQkmNtdYlm #MFGDay20 #CreatorsWanted

Manufacturing is essential to Wisconsin’s economy. Today on @MFGDay I want to thank the manufacturers of this great nation and join them in raising awareness of the industry’s need for future creators!
Wishing @POTUS and @FLOTUS a speedy recovery. You and your family are in my thoughts and prayers!   Together we will continue to fight the COVID-19 virus.

Last night Ms. Angie Kennell was honored by @CCAInstitute as the #WI07 2020 Angel in Adoption.   Thank you to Ms. Kennell and to all honorees for their extraordinary work to make the dream of a family a reality for every child.

Impressive work by researchers at MacIver Inst. correcting inaccurate #covid19 information from @DHSWI. It's critical that people receive accurate data so they can make informed decisions. Thanks to @MacIverWisc for being on the job.  https://t.co/Qexkyi3MVy
Congratulations to Judge Amy Coney Barrett on her nomination to the Supreme Court today!  Well deserved! https://t.co/A8xhjAI6xq

House Republicans are committed to:   🇺🇸 Restoring the American way of life 🇺🇸 Rebuilding the American economy 🇺🇸 Renewing the American dream   Read more on our #CommitmentToAmerica: https://t.co/4P9iggqHBs
Read the press release here:  https://t.co/cCS6l6eNQk

Last night I introduced legislation calling for an end to the outdated “One China Policy” and closer ties with our allies in #Taiwan.   #America doesn’t need a permission slip from Communist #China to talk to our democratic friends and partners.   It’s time for a change.
Watch live: https://t.co/i7ORjbpIor
Looking forward to joining @RepAndyBiggsAZ tonight for the special order on the House floor.   Tune in to watch! https://t.co/G0qkXHXVEt

Today we remember the thousands who lost their lives and the first responders who ran into the chaos 19 years ago during the 9/11 attacks in New York City and Washington DC.   We will #neverforget their courage and sacrifices. https://t.co/FweiL4Sgbm
But… won’t everyone be wearing #masks on #Halloween? #TrickOrTreat 🤔😷👻🎃 https://t.co/KkMquAt2Ut

Today with @RepPeteStauber I introduced legislation to permanently remove the gray wolf from the federal endangered species list. We need to return the authority to control the gray wolf population back to where it belongs: the hands of state lawmakers and wildlife officials.

Read my latest op-ed on how America’s privately owned shipyards like #FraserShipyards could help boost the capabilities of the #USNavy save taxpayers money and boost the northern #Wisconsin economy.  https://t.co/qbJOHavKfU
Once again the message from liberal politicians is ‘do as we say not as we do.'  #DoubleStandard #PelosiBlowout #LightfootHaircut #DeBlasioGym  https://t.co/OORQ1aJiLc

Great news for US agriculture & our friends in #Taiwan.  Free and fair trade between free and fair countries is win-win and I look forward to formal talks for a #US #TaiwanFTA  https://t.co/OD3Zn8eL68
I have asked AG Barr to open a Civil Rights investigation into the possible politically motivated killing of Bernell Trammell.  Read the letter: https://t.co/QhejaEEKbt

@GOPLeader has the facts.  Instead of dealing with real crises we are being called back to Washington to deal with a phony crisis and vote on a bill that had no chance for amendments. https://t.co/6VBIYfB5qZ
Today is the 100th anniversary of Women’s Suffrage in America.  Did you know Wisconsin was the first state to ratify the 19th Amendment on June 10th 1919?  https://t.co/rPmkmwIy28

Blocking freeways is not peaceful protest. It is dangerous and must stop. Obstructing traffic jeopardizes access to vital emergency services. Wisconsin businesses and workers rely on I-94.  @SecElaineChao @TheJusticeDept   https://t.co/JLVv7CDsAj
As I described to #AGBarr during a recent @JudiciaryGOP hearing some leaders continue to turn a blind eye to lawlessness. https://t.co/598TnGDq0Y

These violent riots are no “myth”. https://t.co/dChud471op

I asked House Democrats to allow an up-or-down vote on my amendment to the Interior Dept budget that would end Washington meddling in Wisconsin wolf management decisions.   We will find out tomorrow if they do. Stay tuned. https://t.co/ae9iAo4Sn1
With lawmakers returning to their states for the Independence Day work period I was back home in #WI07 this week!  READ MORE: https://t.co/Xs2bDrqqDQ

Today we come together to celebrate our great country!   We reflect on the sacrifices of our veterans and the wisdom of our founders who made it possible for generations of Americans to live a free and fulfilling life.   Happy 4th of July! https://t.co/LaS1cIdvto
I’ve got some updates to share with you from this week in our latest edition of the Telegram.  READ HERE: https://t.co/K8VMZuqm08
We set another record with 4.8 million jobs created last month!   Another great sign that our country is getting back to work and our strong economic recovery is continuing.  https://t.co/beobquZCEa

Today the #USMCA goes into effect.  The agreement cuts red tape and allows for freer and fairer trade between the US Canada and Mexico.   Truly a win for Wisconsin small businesses and farmers.   https://t.co/QbmiMaH1xp

Welcome to Wisconsin @POTUS! https://t.co/5GhR0Hnsoz

On @620wtmj today @GovEvers once again described violent rioters as “protesters” and suggested that destruction of property and assault and battery are somehow protected by the 1st Amendment. If he can’t tell the difference he’s not qualified to lead the people of Wisconsin.
Property damage destruction and physical assault are not legitimate forms of political discourse.   Enough is enough. https://t.co/0SxHoDANk3
Today I released a statement on the violence in Madison and called for the resignation of Governor Evers.   Read the statement here:   https://t.co/bd1CanCa2h
Peaceful protest is legal. Destroying and defacing monuments and memorials is not. https://t.co/aQX2DkX3s1
Violence has no place in America.  Today I released a statement on the device left at the Hudson GOP office in Hudson WI.   READ HERE:  https://t.co/PmpKiUessv
Wisconsin shows lower unemployment rates than states that imposed the most severe lockdowns during the pandemic.  Let’s reopen America and get back to work!  https://t.co/oCiWRPLcNr

Forced online schooling is unfair to rural families.   “The least privileged kids will be stuck...Children will be pushed into the next grade regardless of whether they’re ready. Many will never catch up.”   #ReopenOurSchools and get kids back to class. https://t.co/gxrSzpB7Qt

Marshfield Medical Center in #WI07 awarded $1 million to aid services impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic.   Let’s continue to work together to get Wisconsin and America back up on her feet again. https://t.co/c1PCeGB8j5
2.5 million jobs added in May unemployment down and largest monthly rise in retail sales on record!   Great news for American families workers and employers.  https://t.co/sqtiexDoDP

Deeply saddened to hear the passing of Cheryl Sensenbrenner advocate for Americans with disabilities and the wife of fellow Wisconsin Congressman Jim Sensenbrenner. My thoughts and prayers are with the Sensenbrenner family.

All government agencies and programs benefit from proper oversight and appropriate transparency. That’s just good government.    But abolishing entire police departments is dangerous and reckless. https://t.co/7qnLe8wXoJ

We can protect elderly and vulnerable citizens without hurting kids’ education. That’s why I joined @RepJimBanks in backing the Reopen Our Schools Act so students can safely return to the classroom this fall. It's time to get back to school without overly restrictive conditions. https://t.co/rFbC5djQrz

I support this important reform from @RealDonaldTrump which will help speed up key infrastructure projects create good family wage jobs and ensure tax dollars are spent on concrete and asphalt.  Not wasted on endless paperwork and costly red tape.  https://t.co/Zlj5oqFTH1

News report in today's @journalsentinel by @WisVoter on my arrival in Congress during challenging times.   In 200+ years Americans have faced difficult circumstances but always expected their elected officials to show up.  https://t.co/HPNhn6BlH7

Unemployment rates down as American employers added 2.5 million jobs in May.  It’s time we open small businesses and get back to work to keep this recovery going. #OpenAmerica  https://t.co/hoeJIKdV2c
